page.title: 08 THE CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The players of the Cricket Club play most Saturdays in the summer at their home ground on{Roadwater}recreation field after the sheep have been chased out. Every Tuesday evening they cut the grass and go over the pitch with a heavy roller that takes at least four men to push it. The rolling is done in about an hour and afterwards they play a pratice match. The club has been playing for over 60 years and a team of 11 has always managed turn out at half past two on Saturday afternoons wearing whites. Although they have only won the cup once the players enjoy the game because there is never any arguing. Some enjoy the tea, made by their wives, in the{village hall} even more than the game. Each player provides his own kit and pays Â£1 a match towards the cost of the new ball and refreshments.
